alert.note: Alert for Denver (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 11 at 12:14PM MDT until May 11 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Along the lower part of Sand Creek in the following counties, Adams and Denver. * WHEN...Until 815 PM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Including the bike path near E. 60th Ave. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1209 PM MDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing small stream flooding. Rapid rises have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northern Denver and southwestern Commerce City Along Sand Creek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
